# iosxr_ethernet_sla (Resource)

This resource can manage the Ethernet SLA configuration.

## Example Usage

```terraform
resource "iosxr_ethernet_sla" "example" {
  profile_name                             = "SLA-PROFILE-1"
  type                                     = "cfm-delay-measurement"
  probe_send_burst_every_interval          = 30
  probe_send_burst_every_seconds           = true
  probe_send_burst_packet_count            = 5
  probe_send_burst_packet_interval_seconds = 1
  probe_packet_size                        = 1500
  probe_packet_test_pattern_hex            = 4369
  probe_priority                           = 7
  statistics_measure = [
    {
      type                                         = "round-trip-delay"
      aggregate_bins                               = 5
      aggregate_width                              = 1000
      aggregate_usec                               = true
      buckets_size                                 = 5
      buckets_probes                               = true
      buckets_archive                              = 10
      thresholds_stateful_log_on_max_value         = 1000
      thresholds_stateful_log_on_mean_value        = 1000
      thresholds_stateful_log_on_sample_count      = 10
      thresholds_stateful_log_on_in_and_above_bin  = 5
      thresholds_stateful_efd_on_max_value         = 2000
      thresholds_stateful_efd_on_mean_value        = 2000
      thresholds_stateful_efd_on_sample_count      = 10
      thresholds_stateful_efd_on_in_and_above_bin  = 5
      thresholds_stateless_log_on_max_value        = 2000
      thresholds_stateless_log_on_mean_value       = 2000
      thresholds_stateless_log_on_sample_count     = 10
      thresholds_stateless_log_on_in_and_above_bin = 5
    }
  ]
  schedule_every_minutes  = 1
  schedule_every_for_time = 1
  schedule_every_for_unit = "minutes"
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `profile_name` (String) Per-profile configuration
- `type` (String) Type of packet that operations using this profile will send

### Optional

- `device` (String) A device name from the provider configuration.
- `probe_packet_size` (Number) Specify the minimum size of each packet in the probe (packets will be padded if needed)
  - Range: `1`-`9000`
- `probe_packet_test_pattern_hex` (Number) Use an optionally specified hex pattern for packet padding
  - Range: `0`-`4294967295`
- `probe_priority` (Number) Specify the priority to use when sending packets
  - Range: `0`-`7`
- `probe_send_burst_every_hours` (Boolean) Time is in hours
- `probe_send_burst_every_interval` (Number) Specify how often bursts within a probe should be sent
  - Range: `1`-`3600`
- `probe_send_burst_every_minutes` (Boolean) Time is in minutes
- `probe_send_burst_every_seconds` (Boolean) Time is in seconds
- `probe_send_burst_once` (Boolean) Send a single burst
- `probe_send_burst_packet_count` (Number) Specify the number of packets in each burst
  - Range: `2`-`1200`
- `probe_send_burst_packet_interval_milliseconds` (Number) Specify the interval between packets in each burst
  - Range: `50`-`30000`
- `probe_send_burst_packet_interval_seconds` (Number) Specify the interval between packets in each burst
  - Range: `1`-`30`
- `probe_send_packet_every_hours` (Boolean) Time is in hours
- `probe_send_packet_every_interval` (Number) Specify how often packets within a probe should be sent
  - Range: `1`-`10000`
- `probe_send_packet_every_milliseconds` (Boolean) Time is in milliseconds
- `probe_send_packet_every_minutes` (Boolean) Time is in minutes
- `probe_send_packet_every_seconds` (Boolean) Time is in seconds
- `probe_send_packet_once` (Boolean) Send a single packet
- `probe_synthetic_loss_calculation_packets` (Number) Specify the number of packets used in each FLR calculation
  - Range: `10`-`12096000`
- `schedule_every_at_hours` (Number) Hours (hh:mm UTC)
  - Range: `0`-`23`
- `schedule_every_at_minutes` (Number) Minutes (hh:mm UTC)
  - Range: `0`-`59`
- `schedule_every_day` (Boolean) Schedule once every day
- `schedule_every_for_time` (Number) Duration of operation (may be seconds, minutes, hours, days, or weeks)
  - Range: `1`-`3600`
- `schedule_every_for_unit` (String) Unit of operation (may be seconds, minutes, hours, days, or weeks)
  - Choices: `day`, `hours`, `minutes`, `seconds`, `week`
- `schedule_every_hours` (Number) Interval between operations (hours)
  - Range: `1`-`90`
- `schedule_every_minutes` (Number) Interval between operations (minutes)
  - Range: `1`-`90`
- `schedule_every_week_on` (String) Specify day of week to schedule on
  - Choices: `friday`, `monday`, `saturday`, `sunday`, `thursday`, `tuesday`, `wednesday`
- `statistics_measure` (Attributes List) Specify the type of statistics to collect (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--statistics_measure))

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) The path of the object.

<a id="nestedatt--statistics_measure"></a>
### Nested Schema for `statistics_measure`

Required:

- `type` (String) Specify the type of statistics to collect
  - Choices: `one-way-delay-ds`, `one-way-delay-sd`, `one-way-jitter-ds`, `one-way-jitter-sd`, `one-way-loss-ds`, `one-way-loss-sd`, `round-trip-delay`, `round-trip-jitter`

Optional:

- `aggregate_bins` (Number) Aggregate results into a number of bins
  - Range: `2`-`100`
- `aggregate_none` (Boolean) Perform no aggregation
- `aggregate_usec` (Boolean) Interpret the width in microseconds
- `aggregate_width` (Number) Width in percentage points, to an accuracy of one percentage point
  - Range: `1`-`10000000`
- `aggregate_width_percentage` (Number) Tenths of a percentage point
  - Range: `0`-`9`
- `buckets_archive` (Number) Configure the number of buckets to store internally
  - Range: `1`-`100`
- `buckets_probes` (Boolean) Buckets span multiple probes
- `buckets_size` (Number) Configure the size of each bucket
  - Range: `1`-`100`
- `thresholds_stateful_efd_on_in_and_above_bin` (Number) Specify the bin number in-and-above which samples count towards the threshold sample count
  - Range: `2`-`100`
- `thresholds_stateful_efd_on_max_value` (Number) Threshold is breached when the maximum value crosses the configured threshold value
  - Range: `1`-`2147483647`
- `thresholds_stateful_efd_on_mean_value` (Number) Threshold is breached when the mean value crosses the configured threshold value
  - Range: `1`-`2147483647`
- `thresholds_stateful_efd_on_sample_count` (Number) Threshold is breached when the sample count in bins in and above a certain bin number crosses the configured sample count
  - Range: `1`-`2147483647`
- `thresholds_stateful_log_on_in_and_above_bin` (Number) Specify the bin number in-and-above which samples count towards the threshold sample count
  - Range: `2`-`100`
- `thresholds_stateful_log_on_max_value` (Number) Threshold is breached when the maximum value crosses the configured threshold value
  - Range: `1`-`2147483647`
- `thresholds_stateful_log_on_mean_value` (Number) Threshold is breached when the mean value crosses the configured threshold value
  - Range: `1`-`2147483647`
- `thresholds_stateful_log_on_sample_count` (Number) Threshold is breached when the sample count in bins in and above a certain bin number crosses the configured sample count
  - Range: `1`-`2147483647`
- `thresholds_stateless_log_on_in_and_above_bin` (Number) Specify the bin number in-and-above which samples count towards the threshold sample count
  - Range: `2`-`100`
- `thresholds_stateless_log_on_max_value` (Number) Threshold is breached when the maximum value crosses the configured threshold value
  - Range: `1`-`2147483647`
- `thresholds_stateless_log_on_mean_value` (Number) Threshold is breached when the mean value crosses the configured threshold value
  - Range: `1`-`2147483647`
- `thresholds_stateless_log_on_sample_count` (Number) Threshold is breached when the sample count in bins in and above a certain bin number crosses the configured sample count
  - Range: `1`-`2147483647`

## Import

Import is supported using the following syntax:

The [`terraform import` command](https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/cli/commands/import) can be used, for example:

```shell
terraform import iosxr_ethernet_sla.example "<profile_name>"
```
